page.title: 10HOUSING IN CHEADLE.
page.content: THE AREA BETWEEN THE A34 AND THE MANCHESTER TO STYAL RAILWAY LINE IS QUITE MODERN, MOST OF THE HOUSES ARE ABOUT 15 TO 20 YEARS OLD. THE HOUSES IN THE SOUTHERN AREA ARE EITHER DETATCHED HOUSES OR BUNGALOWS. THE ROADS ARE USUALLY QUIET, HOWEVER, THE FEW EXIT ROADS FROM THE ESTATE TEND TO BE BUSIER AND MORE DANGEROUS. THERE ARE QUITE A FEW SHOPS SUCH AS NEWSAGENTS AND GROCERS WHICH BETWEEN THEM PROVIDE FOR MOST OF THE AREAS NEEDS. IT IS ONLY FOR THEIR MAIN WEEKLY FAMILY SHOPPING THAT PEOPLE HAVE TO TRAVEL TO CENTRES SUCH AS WYTHENSHAW, CHEADLE CENTRE OR STOCKPORT. THE NEWSAGENTS SEEM TO USED MOST OFTEN BY CHILDREN FOR SWEETS AND CHILDRENS MAGAZINES, ALTHOUGH MEN CALL THERE IN THE MORNING OR IN THE EVENING FOR PAPERS OR CIGARETTES.
